title: Identify Safe Sea Ice for Drinking Water
brief: Distinguish between safe and dangerous sea ice to obtain freshwater in arctic waters.
steps: Step 1: Look for old sea ice which is bluish in color, has rounded corners, and splinters easily.
Step 2: Confirm the ice is nearly free of salt content.
Step 3: Avoid new ice which is gray, milky, hard, and salty.
Step 4: Use icebergs only in emergencies - water is fresh but icebergs are dangerous to approach.
warnings: New sea ice is salty and should not be used for drinking water.
Icebergs are extremely dangerous to approach and should only be used as emergency water source.
Always test small amounts first to verify low salt content.
